## SDQ vs SRP

Can Help As psychologists and researchers, the process of comparing and harmonising items from different questionnaires can be challenging. However, this is now made easier with Harmony, especially when dealing with questionnaires such as the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) and the Self Report of Psychopathy (SRP). Looking at the SDQ vs SRP, one can easily see the necessity of a tool like Harmony in making viable comparisons across the different items in these two psychological instruments. Harmony utilizes the power of natural language processing and generative AI models to help aid researchers in harmonising questionnaire items, even those in different languages. What sets Harmony apart is its ability to offer a percentage match between each item in SDQ and SRP, making the process of comparing SDQ vs SRP much less complicated and more efficient. This cuts down on the manual labour and lessens the possibility of human error. Thus, by using Harmony, psychologists and researchers can save valuable time, especially when making comparisons between SDQ vs SRP. The results are also more accurate and reliable. You can simply drag and drop your own questionnaires directly onto the Harmony's web interface. Given the profound utility of Harmony in simplifying and optimizing the process of questionnaire harmonisation, it's an indispensable tool for anyone wanting to make meaningful comparisons between SDQ and SRP.

## Compare the items in SDQ and SRP

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and SRP into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SRP into Harmony</a> - compare SRP with other instruments
